question: Government had issued commemorative stamp & coin for “Nabakalebara 2015". What is Nabakalebara?
option1: An annual Hindu festival held in the Padmanabhaswamy Temple at Thiruvananthapuram
option2: A festival observed in the Jagannath Temple at Puri.
option3: A festival held on the occasion of Makar Sankranti at Sagardwip Island near Kolkata.
option4: A festival observed once in six years at Ganga Ghats, of Varanasi.
answer: A festival observed in the Jagannath Temple at Puri.
explanation: Nabakalebara is a festival observed in the Shree Jagannath Temple at Puri. It marks a symbolic recreation of wooden forms of the four deities of Jagannath, Balabhadra, Subhadra and Sudarshana at Jagannath temple. The occasion occurs every 12th or 19th year of the previous Nabakalebara. The event was in news because Department of Economic Affairs says that coins minted in July 2015, have Lord Jagannath"s depiction incorrect, and calls for more designs.
